definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: In the late summer, the rivers swell and often burst their banks.
sentences.chinese: 夏末，河流漲水，常常沖決河岸。

sentences.english: Flood waters poured through a gap in the embankment of the swollen jumna river.
sentences.chinese: 亞穆納河漲水，洪水從河堤的一道決口衝了出來。

sentences.english: Flood period is seasonal or periodic flood rise phenomenon of rivers.
sentences.chinese: 汛是指江河等水域的季節性或週期性的漲水現象。

sentences.english: We will be with you as rivers rise and fall.
sentences.chinese: 無論河流水漲水落，我們都同你們在一起。

sentences.english: The wall was built along the river in case of floods.
sentences.chinese: 沿江築了堤壩，以防漲水。

sentences.english: The June rise used to be always luck for me;
sentences.chinese: 六月漲水，我往常總會交好運。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
to cut off/to interrupt/to prevent access
water so clear you can see the bottom
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
